lead_paragraph: LyondellBasell Industries lenders face substantial losses as the company seeks to restructure debt that financed a $12.7 billion takeover a year ago, Standard & Poor’s said. The company, which makes plastics and basic chemicals, said it was in talks with banks including Citigroup and Goldman Sachs over the terms of its loans. It had postponed $280 million of interest payments, S.& P. said. LyondellBasell said that it was ”not currently in default according to its agreements with its lenders.” The company, based in the Netherlands, was formed by the December 2007 acquisition of the Lyondell Chemical Company by Basell AF, a takeover that created one of the world’s biggest plastics makers.
